title: Moving charges - electron in external B-field

content.question: An electron is moving at a speed of <math alttext="1.4 times, 10 to the 6 power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math> at a <math alttext="30 degree" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mo>°</mo></math> angle with the horizontal, as shown in the figure. There is an external magnetic field of <math alttext="0.7 tesla" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> directed into the page. What is the magnitude of the magnetic force exerted on the electron by the external magnetic field?

choices.label: <math alttext="7.8 times, 10 to the negative 14 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>14</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math alttext="1.4 times, 10 to the negative 13 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math alttext="1.6 times, 10 to the negative 13 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.6 times, 10 to the negative 13 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
